available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

breweries.description: Shoreline Brewery is a brewery and restaurant located near the shores of Lake Michigan in Michigan City, Indiana. Twelve beers are always on tap, including the World Beer Cup Award winning Beltaine Scottish Ale and Singing Sands Oatmeal Stout, and seasonal beers such as Samuel Jacksons Black IPA, Bavarian Bombshell Black Lager, and the Barrel Aged Imperial Stout Lost Sailor. In the eight years of existence, Shoreline Brewery has evolved and grown into so much more than just a brewery.
breweries.name: Shoreline Brewery

style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.
style.name: American-Style Pale Ale

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

breweries.description: Bent Paddle Brewing Co.® will be a production craft brewery located in Duluth, Minnesota. Our 30-barrel brewery and Duluth’s first production brewery taproom, The Bent Tap, is expected to open in Winter / Spring 2013. We are excited to use the amazing water of Lake Superior along with the talent of our brewers to make some of the freshest, tastiest and most dependable craft beer possible.
breweries.name: Bent Paddle Brewing Co.

data.description: An unexpected visual bend to an American India Pale Ale, this style is one that stands out in a crowd, or if you’re more like us – enjoyed at a campsite…with no crowd. This non-traditional IPA is golden in color with an enormous floral/citrus hop aroma and a supporting malt profile.

style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale
style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale

data.name: Bent Hop Golden IPA

available.name: Year Round

breweries.description: Red Lodge Ales Brewing Company has been brewing fine craft beer since 1998. Our new facility is the largest Solar Powered building in the state of Montana, and our award winning beers are available throughout Montana, Wyoming, and North Dakota .
breweries.name: Red Lodge Ales Brewing Company

data.description:
Bent Nail I.P.A. is a tribute to the hard-working contractors who make their living in Red Lodge. The I.P.A is high in alcohol and hop flavor. We use copious of American cascade hops to give the IPA intense grapefruit and citrus aroma and flavor. 

Bronze medal winner – 2007 Great American Beer Festival. Alcohol content: 6-6.3% by volume.

Available year round in 1/2 barrels and 1/6 barrels, and now in cases of four six-packs.

breweries.description:
Thank you for your interest in Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern. This is a family owned pub and brew house located at 12 Crane Street in Southbridge, Ma. Our goal is to offer a warm and inviting atmosphere where you can savor our array of freshly brewed beer on tap. We also offer a fully stocked bar for those wishing a more exotic cocktail. To accompany these libations we have a delectable selection of pub fare for your enjoyment.

As we gear up for the Dark Horse Tavern's grand opening in mid-June, Bentley Brewing, along with the help of our expert brew master, Tim Daley, will begin production of our four signature beers on tap. In subsequent weeks, we will be expanding our offerings to include four additional beers, as well as two cask ales, which will complete our on-site brewing selection.

Located just off Main Street in Southbridge, we are within easy access to major routes I-84 and the Mass Pike. Parking for over 150 cars and handicapped accessible, we offer outside dining on our spacious patio overlooking the scenic Quinebaug River, multiple large flat screen televisions broadcasting the latest sporting events throughout the bar, gaming options that include championship dartboards and a pool table, and live entertainment on Saturday evenings. You can also look into our brewing area where all the magic happens and Tim would be happy to answer any and all questions and we welcome your suggestions for future offerings. We accept reservations to accommodate parties of 30-70 guests in our conference room that includes a private bar and optional catering.

We are confident that after experiencing our locally grown and freshly prepared food, our fantastic brew and the exceptional service of our dedicated staff, you will make Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern your favorite destination spot. We look forward to welcoming you and your guests in person at our riverside location at 12 Crane Street.
breweries.name: Bentley Brewing Company

data.description: A balanced American IPA brewed with Cascade, Chinook, Columbus, Nugget, and Apollo hops

style.description: Irish-style red ales range from light red-amber-copper to light brown in color. These ales have a medium hop bitterness and flavor. They often don't have hop aroma. Irish-style red ales have low to medium candy-like caramel malt sweetness and may have a balanced subtle degree of roast barley or roast malt character and complexity.  Irish-style Red Ales have a medium body. The style may have low levels of fruity-ester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl should be absent or at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.
style.name: Irish-Style Red Ale

breweries.description:
Like most things, there are various ways to make mead. At Brothers Drake, our philosophy on making mead is based on the following principles:

1. Start Local: We buy local honey, support local agriculture, and produce a local product.

2. Use the Best: We look for the highest quality local product on the market, ordering from the best from the source closest to Ohio.

3. No Heat: We do not boil our honey or any water used in production. The No Heat Method keeps honey flavors true to the source and a better mead.

4. No Added Sulfites: Unlike grapes which have wild yeast growing on them, honey is naturally antiseptic and antibiotic, so no sulfites needed.

5. Build community: We share our knowledge openly and are grateful to people everywhere who ask questions, share their perspective, and engage in an open collaborative dialogue on mead-making.

6. Embrace creativity: Our mead can be paired with wonderful cheeses, appetizers, and entrees, as well as used in cooking and in mixed drinks.

These basic principles guide our craft, our partnerships, and our practices. We look forward to sharing a drink with you!
breweries.name: Brothers Drake Meadery

data.description: Actually, the ‘bergamot’ in our mead is called Scarlet Bee Balm. It’s native to eastern North America and grows right up the street from us at Jorgensen’s Organic farm in Westerville. The firecracker-red flowers are added to our central Ohio wildflower honey with tons of blueberries from Mansfield, Ohio. The result is a balance of berry and tea flavors with a barely sweet finish. If you can stop drinking it long enough to eat… try light, creamy cheeses or along side a fresh lemon sorbet.

style.description: In well-made examples of the style, the fruit is both distinctive and well-incorporated into the honey-sweet-acid-tannin-alcohol balance of the mead. Different types of fruit can result in widely different characteristics; allow for a variation in the final product.
style.name: Other Fruit Melomel

data.name: Bergamot Blue

data.description: English style golden ale with very light bitterness, brewed with lemon peel and then cold conditioned on Townshend's Earl Grey tea leaves.

breweries.description: Breakside Brewery is the invention of Scott Lawrence and Tony Petraglia. Some mutual friends introduced the two after learning they both had a desire to leave their corporate jobs in order to pursue their dream of opening a brew pub. They jumped in head first and committed their minimal financial resources and made it happen.

breweries.description:
In this time of exploding craft brewing around the country you really need to step up your game to stand out in the crowd. No shortcuts. No easy way outs. When we brew, we brew with the best ingredients, the best equipment, and complete devotion to making the best beer we possibly can.

We believe in the exploration and advancement of all things craft brew. We refuse to cut corners and are always looking for new ways to improve on our products. We strive to be the best and until we are we will never stop attempting to blow your minds!
breweries.name: Full Tilt Brewing

data.description:
Full Tilt Brewing’s BERGER COOKIE CHOCOLATE STOUT is brewed with Baltimore’s legendary dessert. This Sweet Stout starts with grist of 2-Row Pale, Crystal 85L, Carapils, Chocolate Malt, and Chocolate Wheat.  The Berger Cookie character begins by adding actual Berger Cookies and lactose to the boil with Nugget and Tettnang hops for balance. Cacao Nibs are added during secondary fermentation enhancing aroma. Finally, vanilla is introduced in the brite tank rounding off Full Tilt’s homage to DeBaufre 
Bakery. “Anytime is a good time, with Berger Cookies”... and Full Tilt!

style.description: Sweet stouts, also referred to as cream stouts, have less roasted bitter flavor and a full-bodied mouthfeel. The style can be given more body with milk sugar (lactose) before bottling. Malt sweetness, chocolate, and caramel flavor should dominate the flavor profile and contribute to the aroma. Hops should balance and suppress some of the sweetness without contributing apparent flavor or aroma. The overall impression should be sweet and full-bodied.
style.name: Sweet or Cream Stout

data.name: Berger Cookie Chocolate Stout

breweries.description: Minhas Craft Brewery is the 10th largest brewery in America. Located in the quaint Swiss town of Monroe in the southern tip of Wisconsin, a town famous for having the most specialty cheesemakers in America, the very famous 'Cheesedays' and of course, world class beers. The brewery has been located downtown since 1845. The brewery consists of 300,000 sqaure feet of heritage and brand new buildings spread over 7 acres of land in the heartland of America. We make all types of beer, ales and lagers. This includes American and Canadian Lagers, Pale Ale, Red Ale, Amber Ale, Bock, Farmhouse Ale, Hefeweizen, Dark, Light, Lager, Ice, Malt Liquours up to 13% alcohol by volume, Classic Pilsner, Euro Pilsner. Oktoberfest, Winter Ale, Lime ansd many more styles of beer. These beers are made with 2 row and 6 row malts and are handcrafted in small batches. We actually have 20 million pints of beer (equivalent) at different stages of finish at all times at the brewery. We also make old fashioned Blumers root beer and sodas. Although not our primary business, we also do contract packaging for Dixie, Berghoff, Kum and Go, Crunk, Atomic and various other companies.
breweries.name: Minhas Craft Brewery

data.description: Starting with a base of US 2-row pilsner malt, we add just enough lightly-kilned Vienna and Munich malts to add a slight caramel character. Hops are New World versions of European classics, smooth and clean, but with some real personality as well.

style.description: This style has low malt (and adjunct) sweetness, is medium bodied, and should contain no or a low percentage (less than 25%) of adjuncts. Color may be light straw to golden. Alcohol content and bitterness may also be greater. Hop aroma and flavor is low or negligible. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent. Note: Some beers marketed as "premium" (based on price) may not fit this definition.
style.name: American-Style Premium Lager

style.description: Dortmunder has medium hop bitterness. Hop flavor and aroma from noble hops are perceptible but low. Sweet malt flavor can be low and should not be caramel-like. The color of this style is straw to deep golden. The body will be medium bodied. Fruity esters, chill haze, and diacetyl should not be perceived.
style.name: Dortmunder / European-Style Export

style.description: A classic German Pilsener is very light straw or golden in color and well hopped. Perception of hop bitterness is medium to high. Noble-type hop aroma and flavor are moderate and quite obvious. It is a well-attenuated, medium-light bodied beer, but a malty residual sweetness can be perceived in aroma and flavor. Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character are below most beer drinkers' taste thresholds and are usually not detectable except to the trained or sensitive palate. Other fermentation or hop related sulfur compounds, when perceived at low levels, may be characteristic of this style. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.
style.name: German-Style Pilsener

data.description: The special worth-giving factor with the Pilsner is the noble hop-bitter, those the beer a pleasant feinherben taste mediate.  Brewed after the German purity requirement of 1516 - with natural raw materials beer connoisseurs the Unerschied taste exclusive: "Feinherber Bergquell Pilsgenuss"

Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character are below most beer drinkers' taste thresholds and are usually not detectable except to the trained or sensitive palate. Other fermentation or hop related sulfur compounds, when perceived at low levels, may be characteristic of this style. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. data.description: Pale straw in color with a brilliant white lacy head, this Unfiltered German wheat beer is an ultra-drinkable, balanced, and effervescent brew for the summer season. A special German yeast strain exhibits notes of banana and clove; while low hop bitterness and a medium body round out this delicious brew.
data.name: Bergsteiger Hefe-weizen

breweries.description: Morgantown's oldest and newest brewpub, located in the heart of downtown Morgantown West Virginia. This casual local pub offers a wide range of craft beers brewed on the premises, great food, a live music venue and full calendar of events.   Meet friends for lunch or dinner, or have a beer and watch the big game on TV.  A must visit for craft beer lovers.
breweries.name: Morgantown Brewing Company

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. Because yeast is present, the beer will have yeast flavor and a characteristically fuller mouthfeel and may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.
style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier

breweries.description: Berkshire Brewing Company Inc. is a regional brewery located in South Deerfield, MA, established in 1994 by Christopher T. Lalli and Gary A. Bogoff, a pair of homebrewers with the vision of being Massachusetts’ local brewery. Our goal is to produce clean, fresh, well-balanced ales & lagers in small batches. At the present time we are capable of producing 580 barrels (17,980 gallons) of fresh beer each week. All of our beer is unfiltered, unpasteurized and contains no chemical additives or preservatives. As craft brewers, we are now producing nine styles of beer year round and seven seasonals.
breweries.name: Berkshire Brewing Company

style.description: American brown ales range from deep copper to brown in color. Roasted malt caramel-like and chocolate-like characters should be of medium intensity in both flavor and aroma. American brown ales have evident low to medium hop flavor and aroma, medium to high hop bitterness, and a medium body. Estery and fruity-ester characters should be subdued. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.
style.name: American-Style Brown Ale

breweries.description:
Nestled on the back roads of Waterford is Virginia's only winery and brewery.  

After tackling the world of winemaking, Lori and Jim Corcoran decided to expand to include their love of beer as well.  Brewer Kevin Bills was brought in, a plan was made, and here we are.  Currently producing beer 3 bbl at a time, we have up to 12 beers on tap at a time, though plans are in the works to upgrade to a 10 bbl system soon.

We have eleven varieties of hops growing just outside our tasting room and anticipate using them in an all Virginia Harvest Pale Ale soon, using barley grown and malted in Virginia. 

Come by the tasting room for a flight of samples, a pint, a growler fill, and Monk's BBQ (voted best food truck in the DC area on WTOP).
breweries.name: Corcoran Brewing Company

Other fermentation or hop related sulfur compounds, when perceived at low levels, may be characteristic of this style. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

style.description: This is very pale in color and the lightest of all the German wheat beers. The unique combination of yeast and lactic acid bacteria fermentation yields a beer that is acidic, highly attenuated, and very light bodied. The carbonation of a Berliner Weisse is high, and hop rates are very low. Clarity may be hazy or cloudy from yeast or chill haze. Hop character should not be perceived. Fruity esters will be evident. No diacetyl should be perceived.
style.name: Berliner-Style Weisse (Wheat)

data.description: The refreshing shandy, so lively as Berlin! Mixed for 50 percent and 50 percent of Berliner Kindl fine lemonade, it is very trendy and lively after-alcohol beer consumption. Regardless of whether the road or at home, come the summer ...

style.description: Fruit beers are any beers using fruit or fruit extracts as an adjunct in either, the mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, fruit qualities. Fruit qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. If a fruit (such as juniper berry) has an herbal or spice quality, it is more appropriate to consider it in the herb and spice beers category. Acidic bacterial (not wild yeast) fermentation characters may be evident (but not necessary) they would contribute to acidity and enhance fruity balance. Clear or hazy beer is acceptable in appearance. A statement by the brewer explaining what fruits are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with fruit, the brewer should also specify the classic style.
style.name: Fruit Beer

data.name: Berliner Kindl Radler

data.description: Lactobacillus is added to this beer to provide a tart and snappy sourness.  Straw in color, light bodied with tart finish.

breweries.description: 2012 GREAT AMERICAN BEER FESTIVAL SMALL BREWPUB and SMALL BREWPUB BREWER OF THE YEAR & 2010 WORLD BEER CUP CHAMPION BREWERY & SMALL BREWPUB, the award winning Basecamp Brewpub is situated in the majestic valley of the Blue Ridge Mountains with a lodge style atmosphere. We brew authentic craft beer in our brewhouse with a traditional German style brewing system and pour fresh brews daily from 16 taps in the pub area. Our menu specializes in oak wood -fired smoked dishes and local fare. We offer children their own special menu too!  Basecamp is open daily: 11:30pm serving lunch & dinner.

locations.hoursOfOperation: Wednesday & Thursday open 1pm - 7pm.  Friday & Saturday open 1pm - 8pm.  Sunday open 1pm - 6pm
locations.name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company - Outpost

breweries.name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company

style.description: This is very pale in color and the lightest of all the German wheat beers. The unique combination of yeast and lactic acid bacteria fermentation yields a beer that is acidic, highly attenuated, and very light bodied. The carbonation of a Berliner Weisse is high, and hop rates are very low. Clarity may be hazy or cloudy from yeast or chill haze. Hop character should not be perceived. Fruity esters will be evident. No diacetyl should be perceived.
style.name: Berliner-Style Weisse (Wheat)

data.name: Berliner Metro

style.description: A classic German Pilsener is very light straw or golden in color and well hopped. Perception of hop bitterness is medium to high. Noble-type hop aroma and flavor are moderate and quite obvious. It is a well-attenuated, medium-light bodied beer, but a malty residual sweetness can be perceived in aroma and flavor. Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character are below most beer drinkers' taste thresholds and are usually not detectable except to the trained or sensitive palate. Other fermentation or hop related sulfur compounds, when perceived at low levels, may be characteristic of this style. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.
style.name: German-Style Pilsener

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

data.description: Berliner Pilsner a classic German Pilsener beer.

style.description: A classic German Pilsener is very light straw or golden in color and well hopped. Perception of hop bitterness is medium to high. Noble-type hop aroma and flavor are moderate and quite obvious. It is a well-attenuated, medium-light bodied beer, but a malty residual sweetness can be perceived in aroma and flavor. Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character are below most beer drinkers' taste thresholds and are usually not detectable except to the trained or sensitive palate. Other fermentation or hop related sulfur compounds, when perceived at low levels, may be characteristic of this style. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.
style.name: German-Style Pilsener

data.name: Berliner Pilsner

breweries.description: Jack's Abby Brewing was formally founded in January of 2011 by three brothers, Jack, Eric and Sam Hendler, who grew up in a family business. The ideas behind it, however, date back over ten years to when Jack was still in college experimenting with home brews. After graduating, Jack became the head brewer of one of the largest brewpubs in the eastern US. He earned joint diplomas in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Chicago and Doemans Academy of Munich. Currently he is a member of the Master Brewers Association.
breweries.name: Jack's Abby Brewing
